svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: The Gini index measures the distribution of household equivalized income, including zero income. A higher Gini index
is indicative of a more unequal distribution of income.
Source: Socio-Economic Database for Latin America and the Caribbean (CEDLAS and The World Bank)
